message.text: Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{contents: read}}

workflow_dispatch.NEW_TAG: Tag name of the next release

steps.run: yarn build && yarn run test-dist && git clone https://${GH_TOKEN}@github.com/gautamkrishnar/blog-post-workflow.git publish-repo  > /dev/null 2>&1 && cd publish-repo && yarn version --new-version ${NEW_TAG} --no-git-tag-version && cp -fv ../dist/blog-post-workflow.js ./dist/blog-post-workflow.js && git config --global user.email "gkr@tuta.io" && git config --global user.name "gkr-bot" && git add ./dist/blog-post-workflow.js ./package.json && git commit -m "[skip ci] Published ${NEW_TAG}" && git push --quiet
